stem: A patient was diagnosed to have a duodenal 2 weeks ago. He was given a course of ranitidine. The breath test for H. pylori is positive. What is your choice of management?
disc:
The most common cause of peptic ulcer disease is H. pylori.

Initial treatment includes PPIs + two antibiotics - clarithromycin and amoxicillin. If the response is not adequate metronidazole, levofloxacin or tetracycline are considered.

In suspected cases of resistance, adding bismuth to a change of antibiotics may be beneficial (quadruple therapy).

Eradication should be confirmed with stool antigen or breath test.
tags: Medicine, Gastroenterology, Helicobacter pylori, Duodenal Ulcers
